question: Explain any one of the following:

sub_questions.a: “You’re an actor,” he sneered. “There’s absolutely no future for a boy like you.”
sub_questions.b: “What? That means he will be here for weeks! Ministers don’t see people for weeks, months! Oh, my God!”
sub_questions.c: “You’re a brave boy and get married…… Just do me a favour and leave me in peace.”

question: Explain any one of the following:

sub_questions.a: “When thou sigh’st, thou sigh’st not wind, but sigh’st my soul away.”
sub_questions.b: “I celebrate myself, and sing myself, and what I assume you shall assume, for every atom belonging to me as good belongs to you.”
sub_questions.c: “Macavity, Macavity, there’s no one like Macavity.”

question: Write a précis of the following passage and give a suitable title.

sub_questions.passage: Life without friendship is insipid, tiring and boring. Friendship is a precious thing to be treasured by one and all. A friend in need is a friend indeed. A true friend praises our virtues but does not keep his eyes closed to our faults. He cares for us and shares with us joys as well as sorrows. We turn to our friends for counsel, for comfort, for encouragement. He is our friend, philosopher and guide. Blessed is the man or woman who is lucky to have got a true friend. Such friendship should be preserved at all costs.
